title: Chris Christie reveals Trump's election night moment that made him feel sick
description: CNN's Dana Bash interviews Chris Christie about former President Trump's false election conspiracies and whether Christie regrets supporting Trump.

title: Hear warning to ISS after Russia's dangerous missile test
description: The US strongly condemned a Russian anti-satellite test that forced crew members on the International Space Station to scramble into their spacecraft for safety, calling it "a reckless and dangerous act" and saying that it "won't tolerate" behavior that puts international interests at risk.

title: Space junk is a massive problem. Russia's anti-satellite missile test just made it worse
description: Days after world powers wrapped up a monumental climate summit in Glasgow, another environmental emergency was unfolding -- this time in space.

title: Kyle Rittenhouse's fate is in the jury's hands. Recap what happened in closing arguments
description: The closing arguments have been made and Kyle Rittenhouse's future is up the jury in his trial. Rittenhouse is charged with killing two people and wounded another during unrest in Kenosha, Wisconsin, last summer. CNN's Omar Jimenez reports.

title: How to bring nature into your home and feel better
description: Architects and designers are finding ways of bringing nature into our homes to benefit our health and wellbeing; a concept known as biophilic design. Here are some simple tips you can try to bring the outside in.

title: ​Azeem Rafiq: As you get further up in cricket, 'the game gets whiter and whiter'
description: After a turbulent month which has brought to light multiple allegations of racism by former players of Yorkshire County Cricket Club (YCCC), senior management figures from the club will today answer questions in a UK parliamentary inquiry over the organization's handling of ​Azeem Rafiq's allegations of racism.

title: Europe turns the screws on the unvaccinated as Covid-19 cases climb
description: Europe's leaders are toughening their stances towards unvaccinated people and pursuing measures that increasingly isolate them from the rest of society, as frustration grows over stalling shot rollouts and a wave of Covid-19 infections on the continent.

title: 'We are fighting to stay alive': Migrants throw rocks at guards as violence erupts at the border
description: Violence erupted at the Poland-Belarus border on Tuesday, as migrants desperate to cross into the European Union threw stones at Polish border guards who responded with water cannon and tear gas.

title: Germany suspends approval for Nord Stream 2 pipeline amid rising EU-Russia tensions
description: Natural gas prices in Europe soared on Tuesday after Germany confirmed that it has suspended the process of certifying a new Russian gas pipeline called Nord Stream 2.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon allowed to skip quarantine in Hong Kong
description: Jamie Dimon is the latest big name in business to skip one of the world's longest quarantines.

title: How Biden's infrastructure funding will help the US prepare for future climate disasters
description: Around $50 billion of President Joe Biden's infrastructure package is marked for climate resilience -- replacing roads to withstand extreme rainfall, treating forests to prevent wildfires and shoring up reservoirs that sank to new lows this year amid incredible drought.

title: James Cameron's plea to protect the ocean twilight zone
description: Before the perpetual dark of the deep sea, in the space at the final reaches of daylight, is the ocean twilight zone.

title: What airplane business class will look like in 2025
description: It may feel like 2025 is a long way away, but for airlines' luxurious new business class seats -- which can take years to design and install -- it's right around the corner.

title: Using cannabis in pregnancy linked to aggression and anxiety in children, a study suggests
description: More and more women are using weed in pregnancy but they may want to think twice.

title: At least two explosions rock Ugandan capital Kampala
description: Two explosions rocked the Ugandan capital's city center within 30 minutes of each other on Tuesday, according to police and a journalist at the scene of one of the blasts.

title: Elon Musk sells another $931 million of Tesla stock
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's sales of his company's stock continued Monday. His latest filing promises more are coming.

title: A second HIV patient may have been 'cured' of infection without stem cell treatment in extremely rare case
description: Researchers say they have found a second patient whose body seemingly had rid itself of the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) that causes AIDS -- supporting hope that it may be possible someday to find a way to cure more people of the virus.

title: Taliban parades captured US military vehicles
description: Taliban forces flaunted US armored vehicles during a military parade on Sunday in Kabul

title: Major museum casts fresh doubt over the authenticity of $450M 'Salvator Mundi'
description: The "Salvator Mundi," which sold for $450 million at Christie's auction house as a fully authenticated Leonardo da Vinci, has been downgraded by curators at the Prado national museum in Madrid, Spain. It was bought in November 2017 by the Saudi culture minister, Prince Badr bin Abdullah, apparently for the Louvre Abu Dhabi.

title: Medical staff at Astroworld responded to 11 cardiac arrests at the same time, CEO of medic company says
description: The CEO of ParaDocs, the medic company hired by Astroworld organizers, spoke on camera for the first time Monday to "set the record straight" on what his team did and to defend how hard his staff of more than 70 people worked to save lives.

title: Jurors in Kyle Rittenhouse's homicide trial will begin deliberations today
description: Jurors are set to begin deliberations Tuesday in Kyle Rittenhouse's homicide trial, a day after the prosecution and defense offered dueling assessments of his actions last year during unrest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

title: EU court rules against Poland over judicial appointments
description: The European Union's top court ruled on Tuesday that Polish rules allowing the justice minister to assign judges to higher criminal courts or to remove them without stating reasons violated EU law.

title: How New Zealand's All Blacks handle 'huge public expectation'
description: Every sports team has an expectation to succeed, but few do like the All Blacks.

title: Lekki toll gate shooting could be considered 'a massacre'
description: Lethal violence committed by Nigeria's military on the night of October 20, 2020 could be considered a "massacre," a government-appointed panel concluded Monday -- contradicting previous official accounts of the incident.

title: Girl, 16, says she was raped by hundreds of men in western India
description: At least seven men have been arrested in western India after a 16-year-old girl claimed she was raped hundreds of times by hundreds of men in the latest horrifying case to highlight the country's rampant sexual violence problem.

title: England scores double digits to thrash world's lowest-ranked team San Marino
description: There's David against Goliath, and then there's this.

title: Camped against barbed wire and watched by dogs, a day on the Belarusian border
description: CNN's Matthew Chance reports from the Belarusian side of the border where thousands of migrants are caught in a diplomatic standoff trying to cross into Poland.

title: Nick Kyrgios rows back on support for unvaccinated players
description: Tennis maverick Nick Kyrgios has rowed back on comments supporting unvaccinated athletes, saying it would not be "morally right" to let them play at the Australian Open.

title: 'Totally brutal': Advocate decries killing of pet for Covid prevention in China
description: Covid-19 prevention health workers in China killed a pet corgi while its owner was in quarantine, sparking outcry over extreme measures China is taking to eliminate Covid-19. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: Bitcoin falls as China takes aim once again at 'extremely harmful' crypto mining
description: Chinese authorities are ramping up a crackdown on crypto mining, calling it an "extremely harmful" practice that threatens to jeopardize the country's efforts to reduce carbon emissions.

title: How to use food to boost your immune system
description: Want to fight off infectious diseases this winter? Consider boosting your immune system with nutritious food.

title: Australian women to sue Qatar over forced invasive examinations at Doha airport
description: A group of seven Australian women, some of whom were subjected to invasive medical examinations after authorities found an abandoned baby at Doha international airport, are planning on suing the Qatar government, their lawyer confirmed Tuesday.

title: 'Worse than a circus:' Analyst on election with 97 participants
description: A boxing champion, a former actor turned mayor and a dictator's son are among the 97 candidates running in a chaotic presidential race in the Philippines. CNN's Ivan Watson speaks to Manny Pacquiao, an outsider hoping to challenge the country's political dynasties.

title: 'Megaspider' is biggest of its kind we've ever seen, Australian reptile park says
description: A massive funnel-web spider with fangs capable of piercing human fingernails has been donated to an antivenom program in Australia, sparking an appeal for its anonymous donor to come forward.

title: India opens borders to vaccinated foreign tourists
description: India opened its borders to fully vaccinated foreign tourists entering the country on commercial flights for the first time in nearly two years on Monday.

title: Ambulance driver admitted to drinking, smoking marijuana and taking Adderall before crash that killed patient, police say
description: A Georgia ambulance driver has been arrested and charged with driving under the influence and second-degree homicide-by-vehicle after he crashed the ambulance he was driving, killing the dialysis patient he was transporting, according to authorities.

title: Google is making its biggest investment ever in Australia
description: Google is making its largest-ever investment in Australia, after a clash with the government that saw the tech giant threaten to shut down search there earlier this year.

title: See who got sent home in a 'Dancing with the Stars' double elimination
description: An Olympian and a famous actress were eliminated sending the four remaining couples on to the finals next week.

title: Bannon's circus undercuts January 6 probe's hardline legal strategy
description: The House January 6 investigation hoped to send a fear-inducing message deep into Donald Trump's inner circle by opening the way to the prosecution of Steve Bannon.

title: Russia's anti-satellite missile test forced space station crew to scramble for safety
description: The US is concerned that Russia carried out a major anti-satellite weapons test over the weekend, two US officials told CNN. One of the officials said it may have created a potentially dangerous debris field in space.

title: Billionaire couple sells off $676M of art in divorce settlement
description: Nearly three years after the high-profile divorce proceedings of New York real estate developer Harry Macklowe and his wife, Linda, a portion of their art collection has smashed estimates to sell for over $676 million.

title: Christie describes being attacked about his weight
description: Former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie talks to CNN's Dana Bash about the effect criticism about his weight has had on him.

title: January 6 committee expected to discuss how to deal with Meadows in Tuesday meeting
description: The House select committee investigating the January 6 attack on the US Capitol had yet to come to a consensus as of Monday night on dealing with former Trump White House chief of staff Mark Meadows' lack of compliance.

title: Cuban activists blockaded at home amid protest clampdown
description: Cuban activists said they were forcibly trapped inside their homes on Monday, as the government clamped down on plans for opposition protests on the island.

title: Bird flu spreads in Europe and Asia, putting poultry industry on alert
description: Several outbreaks of severe bird flu in Europe and Asia have been reported in recent days to the World Organisation for Animal Health (OIE), in a sign the virus is spreading quickly again.
